definition: (of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Just those tiny serifs make sure there are thick and thin parts, like the 'e' has.
sentences.chinese: 就是这些细小的衬线让他有像“e”一样的粗细对比。

sentences.english: Thin serifs do not emboss well unless they are large and well defined.
sentences.chinese: 不薄衬线浮雕，除非它们是大而明确的。

sentences.english: Sans-serif fonts have generally been considered easier to read on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 无衬线字体，一般认为它更容易在屏幕上阅读。

sentences.english: I find that serifs become more acceptable at higher sizes.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得衬线变得更高体积更易于接受。

sentences.english: This is the font used to display text that is marked up as sans-serif.
sentences.chinese: 该字体用于显示标为无衬线字体的文字。

definition: bristles lying down (brush movement in painting)
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
